Key Match Events: The Cubs were shut out in three of their past four games, and are 1-4 to start a six-game homestand.
Pre-Game Insights: Manager Craig Counsell said that the team needs to create offense on a daily basis to win games in the current environment.
Post-Match Reflections: Team president Jed Hoyer acknowledged that the team's offense has lacked consistency and that they need to rely on balance more than consolidation of WAR.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The article mentions that the Cubs' offense scored the sixth-most runs in baseball last summer, but has largely disappeared this season.
Others: The article compares the Cubs' offense to the Yankees', noting that the Yankees have a superstar presence in Aaron Judge and Juan Soto, which the Cubs lack.
